Navigation
Name Tutor/Markup/StructureMarkup/TableOfContents
Synopsis Generate a table of contents.
Syntax <toc Concept OptDepth>
Description Generate a table of contents for all subconcepts of Concept to a depth of OptLevel. When OptDepth is missing, 1000 will be used as default depth.

A table of contents can be generated for any concept at any level. This useful for summary pages.
Examples A table of contents of 1 level deep: <toc Tutor 1> will generate:
  • Contents: Table of Contents.
  • Authoring: Creating and writing a course using the RascalTutor.
  • Concept: A concept is the basic building block of a course.
  • Markup: Markup directives for creating concept pages.
The full table of contents is generated by <toc Tutor>
  • Contents: Table of Contents.
    • Authoring: Creating and writing a course using the RascalTutor.
      • Concept: A concept is the basic building block of a course.
        • Name: The name of a concept.
          • Synopsis: One-line summary of the concept that is usable as a tool tip.
            • Syntax: Part of the synopsis that summarizes syntax introduced by this concept.
              • Types: Part of the synopsis that describes any types or typing rules introduced by this concept.
                • Function: Part of the synopsis that describes function signatures introduced by this concept.
                  • Details: Links to more detailed concepts that complement the description of the current concept.
                    • Description: Gives a concise explanation of the concept.
                      • Examples: Examples to illustrate the concept.
                        • Benefits: Briefly lists known advantages of the concept.
                          • Pitfalls: Comprehensive list of known shortcomings or usage problems of the concept.
                            • Questions: Questions about the concept.
                            • Markup: Markup directives for creating concept pages.
                              • InlineMarkup: Markup directives used in input lines.
                                • Bold: Create bold text.
                                  • Callout: Create a numeric callout for the digits 1--9.
                                    • Code: Create inline code fragments.
                                      • ExternalURL: Refer to an external URL.
                                        • Image: Include an image.
                                          • Italic: Create italic text.
                                            • ReferenceToConcept: Refer to a concept in this course or another course.
                                              • Variable: Markup for a variable.
                                              • QuestionMarkup: Mark up for interactive questions.
                                                • Choice: Multiple-choice question.
                                                  • Type: A question about a Rascal type.
                                                    • TypeDescriptor: Description of a Rascal types used in type and value questions.
                                                      • Value: Question about the value of a Rascal expression or program.
                                                      • StructureMarkup: Markup for structured text entities.
                                                        • BulletLists: A (possible nested) list of bullet points.
                                                          • figure: Markup of code that generates a figure.
                                                            • listing: Markup for a code listing.
                                                              • NamedParagraph: Mark up for a named paragraph.
                                                                • NewParagraph: Introduce a new paragraph.
                                                                  • NumberedLists: A (possibly nested) list of numbered points.
                                                                    • screen: Include the results of an interactive session of the Rascal interpreter.
                                                                      • Table: Mark up for a table.
                                                                        • TableOfContents: Generate a table of contents.
                                                                          • warning: Mark up for a warning.
                                                                        A table of contents for StructureMarkup is generated by <toc Tutor/Markup/StructureMarkup 1>:

                                                                        • BulletLists: A (possible nested) list of bullet points.
                                                                        • figure: Markup of code that generates a figure.
                                                                        • listing: Markup for a code listing.
                                                                        • NamedParagraph: Mark up for a named paragraph.
                                                                        • NewParagraph: Introduce a new paragraph.
                                                                        • NumberedLists: A (possibly nested) list of numbered points.
                                                                        • screen: Include the results of an interactive session of the Rascal interpreter.
                                                                        • Table: Mark up for a table.
                                                                        • TableOfContents: Generate a table of contents.
                                                                        • warning: Mark up for a warning.
                                                                        [Edit] | [New Subconcept] | [Recompile Course] | [Warnings]
